results.title: Adriana Lecouvreur
results.creator_credit: Hugh Davidson, John Copley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 18 February 1984 this performance of Francesco Cilea’s ” Adriana Lecouvreur” features the grand voice of Dame Joan Sutherland, along with John Shaw, Anson Austin and Heather Begg, The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge. Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Adoption: children are waiting
results.creator_credit: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: This film will inform and encourage prospective adopting parents and be helpful to professionals in the child-welfare field. In interviews, three couples relate their experiences of adopting older or handicapped children. A fourth couple explains how they, as foster parents, try to prepare children emotionally for adoption.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films

results.title: Adolescence and learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas G. Gregory and Lawren Productions

results.title: Adieu Voyages Lents
results.brief_description:
This multi-parts film deals with the difficulties of sustaining a relationship under the pressure of modern life. In ‘Nuit, une guerre’, a couple’s amourous pursuits are interrupted by the noises coming from the street and the neighbouring appartments. In ‘Entrevu par l’indiscretion d’un Judas’, a man hears is own story told on the radio by a ‘talk-back’ programme listener and realises his wife has left him to seek refuge with her mother in the country. In ‘Adieu voyages lents’, Simone reveals to her mother the reason for leaving her husband and aborting the child she was expecting.

Credits: Director, writer, Marie-Genevieve Ripeau ; photography, Jean-Francis Gondre.
Cast: Andree Tainsy, Michele Simonnet, Evelyne Dandry, Jean-Francois Stevenin, Virgineie Thevenet.

results.title: Adieu Philippine
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rozier, Georges de Beauregard and Alain Raygot
results.brief_description:
In his last few months before military service, a young TV technician, on holiday, is torn bewteen two girls. Rozier’s first feature, using improvisation, amateur performers, hidden microphones and cameras in real locations, had a rough spontaneity very much in line with the aesthetics of the ‘nouvelle vague’. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producers, Alain Raygot, Jean-Pierre Vic ; director, Jaqcues Rozier ; writers, Jacques Rozier, Michele O’Glor ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Maxime Saury, Paul Mattei, Jacques Danjean.
Cast: Jean-Claude Aimini, Yveline Cery, Arlette Gilbert, Jeanne Perez, Chouquette Deschamps, Maurice Garrel, Vittorio Caprioli.

results.title: Adieu L'ami = So Long, Friend
results.brief_description:
A friendship develops between a French doctor and an American mercenary when both are discharged from the army. Dino and Propp combine forces to help a woman return some stolen bonds before the crime can be discovered. They become trapped for three days in the underground vault system. Propp helps Dino escape before he is captured by the police. The two fall victim to the woman who was used as bait to get them to open the safe. Note: In this version, Charles Bronson’s voice is dubbed in French by American filmmaker John Berry.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Jean Herman ; writer, Sebastien Japrisot ; photography ; Jean-Jacques Tarbes ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Alain Delon, Charles Bronson, Olga Georges-Picot, Bernard Fresson, Brigitte Fossey.

results.title: ADHA: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It examines ADHD in the under 5’s, school age children, and adults, as well as covering diagnosis, behaviour techniques, alternative treatment and medication.

results.title: Adelaide celebrations
results.creator_credit: Penny Chapman, Terry Jennings, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the many theatre arts and crafts on display at Adelaide Festival time. An interesting study of Adelaide at the time of its biennial festival of the arts, in 1976.

results.title: Adelaide advances
results.creator_credit: Carl Kayser, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Auster Films
results.brief_description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. A father is driving his son to one of the research laboratories and as they approach the city, he tells the boy of local industries and the contributions made to the South Australian economy by the Agricultural Research Institute. Includes scenes of the landmarks of the city and a visit to the Onkaparinga Racecourse. Sponsored by the Australian News & Information Bureau and narrated by David Low.

results.title: Adaptation
results.creator_credit: Spike Jonze, Jonathan Demme, Vincent Landay, Edward Saxon, Intermedia and Columbia
results.brief_description: From the creators of “Being John Malkovich” - director Spike Jonze and screenwriter Charlie Kaufman - comes the strangely twisted tale of woe of a screenwriter given the task of adapting a novel to the screen. In a desperate struggle, he actually writes himself (and his twin brother) into the story and reality and fiction start to blur, creating some dramatic and at times, comic situations. Cast includes Nicholas Cage, Meryl Streep and Chris Cooper (Academy Award Winner Best Supporting Actor for this role). Screenplay by Charlie and Donald Kaufman. “Adaptation” is also winner of two Golden Globe Awards. Based on the book “The Orchard Thief” by Susan Orlean.
